document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Fábio G. L., Cipola, Nikolas G. & Almeida, Eduardo A. B.
document.masterDocTitle: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

bibRefCitation.author: Denis
bibRefCitation.refString: Denis, J. R. (1931) Contributo alla conoscenza del " microgenton " di Costa Rica. II. Collemboles de Costa Rica avec une contribution au species de l'ordre. Bollettino del Laboratorio di Zoologia Generale e Agrario 23: 69 - 170.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Salina tristani Denis, 1931: 149
, 167-173, San José ,
Costa Rica
(orig. descr.).

subSubSection.paragraph: Body with reduced pigments, general present on lateral trunk; Ant I with 4 mac; Th II–Abd I with 6–8, 6–10, 2–6 central mac, respectively; Abd III with 3 lateral mac ( am6 , pm6 , p6 ); Abd IV with 8 central ( A3–5 absent) and 7 lateral mac; trochanteral
organ with 13 spine-like chaetae; collophore with 8 anterior, 4–5 posterior and 15–16 lateral flap chaetae; manubrial plate with 3 chaetae.

The variations observed in species of
S . tristani
from Brazil are as in Mari Mutt ( 1987 a, 1987 b), as reduction of 2 mac in Th II ( p1p , p4 ), 4 in Th III ( p1p , p2p , p3p , p4 ), and 4 in Abd I ( a1–3 , m5 ). However, in the specimens from Brazil frequently m1 mac is absent, and mucro may have 3 or 4 teeth, at least in one body side. These variations partially influence the diagnosis of
S . tristani
, since they were used for the difference therein of
S . dedoris
,
S . hermana
and
S . panamae
, at least the chaetotaxy of Th II-III (Mari Mutt, 1987 b). However, the reduced color pattern (typical pattern in
S . dedoris
), collophore with 4–5 posterior chaetae ( 0–2 in
S . dedoris
and
S . hermana
), and chaetotaxy of Th II–Abd I with extra mac present in
S . tristani
, are still the best way to differentiate, since in these species has reduced chaetotaxy (see Table 2 ).
